Sentencas: In the current manufacturing process of novel LaNbO4-based proton conducting fuel cells a thin layer of the electrolyte is deposited by wet ceramic coating on NiO-LaNbO4 based anode and co-sintered at 1200-1300 degrees C.
Titulo: Investigation of compatible anode systems for LaNbO4-based electrolyte in novel proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The chemical compatibility of NiO with acceptor doped LaNbO4 material is crucial to ensure viability of the cell, so potential effects of other phases resulting from off-stoichiometry in acceptor doped LaNbO4 should also be explored.
Titulo: Investigation of compatible anode systems for LaNbO4-based electrolyte in novel proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Compatibility of NiO with Ca-doped LaNbO4 and its typical off-set compositions (La3NbO7 and LaNb3O9) are investigated in this work.
Titulo: Investigation of compatible anode systems for LaNbO4-based electrolyte in novel proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It is shown that while NiO does not react with Ca-doped LaNbO4, fast reaction occurs with La3NbO7 or LaNb3O9.
Titulo: Investigation of compatible anode systems for LaNbO4-based electrolyte in novel proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: La3NbO7 and NiO form a mixed conducting perovskite phase LaNi2/3Nb1/3O3, while LaNb3O9 and NiO form either NiNb2O6 or Ni4Nb2O9 depending on the annealing temperature.
Titulo: Investigation of compatible anode systems for LaNbO4-based electrolyte in novel proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This implies that manufacturing LaNbO4-based proton conducting fuel cells requires a strict control of the stoichiometry of the electrolyte.
Titulo: Investigation of compatible anode systems for LaNbO4-based electrolyte in novel proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells
Investigation of compatible anode systems for LaNbO4-based electrolyte in novel proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells
